intro: Phyllanthus longistylus, commonly known as the long-styled phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-white or yellowish, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Phyllanthus longistylus is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional medicine systems.
